title: "conflicting implementations of trait" error missing helpful note on private traits

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
If I write this simple, but incorrect program, rust gives me a useful output message:

```rust
pub trait MyTrait {}

impl<T: Copy> MyTrait for T {}

impl MyTrait for String {}
```

The output here is:

```
   Compiling conflicttest v0.1.0 (/home/daboross/conflicttest)
error[E0119]: conflicting implementations of trait `MyTrait` for type `std::string::String`:
 --> src/lib.rs:5:1
  |
3 | impl<T: Copy> MyTrait for T {}
  | --------------------------- first implementation here
4 | 
5 | impl MyTrait for String {}
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ conflicting implementation for `std::string::String`
  |
  = note: upstream crates may add new impl of trait `std::marker::Copy` for type `std::string::String` in future versions

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0119`.
error: Could not compile `conflicttest`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

The `note: ...` is super nice! If I make the trait non-public, though, then the note is no longer produced.

```rust
trait MyTrait {}

impl<T: Copy> MyTrait for T {}

impl MyTrait for String {}
```

gives the error:

```
$ cargo build
   Compiling conflicttest v0.1.0 (/home/daboross/conflicttest)
error[E0119]: conflicting implementations of trait `MyTrait` for type `std::string::String`:
 --> src/lib.rs:5:1
  |
3 | impl<T: Copy> MyTrait for T {}
  | --------------------------- first implementation here
4 | 
5 | impl MyTrait for String {}
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ conflicting implementation for `std::string::String`

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0119`.
error: Could not compile `conflicttest`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

Ideally this would produce an identical note.
